thread.title: CBI searches Bank of Baroda branch, 2 other places for fishy remittances
thread.title_full: CBI searches Bank of Baroda branch, 2 other places for fishy remittances | The Financial Express

author: financialexpress.com
title: CBI searches Bank of Baroda branch, 2 other places for fishy remittances
text:
Other Articles Indian rupee firms up against the US dollar, surges 77 paise to close at 8-week high at 64.74 RBI rate cut after-effects: Small savings to feel the squeeze Base rate to come down next week: Romesh Sobti, Managing Director & CEO, IndusInd bank CBI teams today carried out searches at three locations here in connection with alleged Rs 6,000 crore remittances sent from Bank of Baroda to Hong Kong camouflaged as payments for non-existent imports.
The agency searched Ashok Vihar branch of the Bank besides residences of bank officers SK Garg, AGM and Jainish Dubey, Officer, Foreign Exchange.
The unusual remittances were spotted in the audit report of the bank, CBI sources said.
“The Central Bureau of Investigation has registered a case under section 120-B (criminal conspiracy) read with 420 (cheating) of IPC and Section 13(2) r/w 13(1)(d) of Prevention of Corruption Act, 1988 against 59 current account holders and unknown bank officials and private persons on a complaint from Bank of Baroda,” CBI Spokesperson Devpreet Singh said here.
The FIR alleged that “59 current account holders and unknown bank officials conspired to send overseas remittances, mostly to Hong Kong, of Foreign Exchange worth approximately Rs 6,000 crores in illegal and irregular manner in violation of established banking norms under the garb of payments towards suspected non-existent imports.”
The Enforcement Directorate has also registered a case and carried out searches in this connection.
Yesterday, Congress had demanded an inquiry in to the matter. “It was strange that the money was sent to buy cashew, pulses and rice from Hong Kong,” Congress spokesperson RPN Singh had said.
 10, 2015 3:37 pm
